intro: Tragia mexicana, commonly known as Mexican bitterleaf, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its small, yellowish-green flowers and spiny, lance-shaped leaves. The plant is often found in dry, disturbed areas and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. Its fruits are capsule-like structures that release tiny seeds when mature. Tragia mexicana is also known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
